history.title: The Idea
history.description: Monica discovered tornado potatoes at a Korean street food festival and fell in love with the unique spiral-cut concept. The idea for bringing this amazing snack to Chardon was born.

history.title: The Beginning
history.description: Mooses Tornado Potatoes officially launched in Chardon Square. Our first day serving the community was met with curiosity and excitement as locals tried tornado potatoes for the first time.

history.title: Growing Popular
history.description: Word spread quickly throughout Geauga County. We expanded our menu with new flavors like Buffalo Chicken and Loaded Chili, becoming a must-visit spot in downtown Chardon.

history.title: Community Events
history.description: We started participating in local festivals and events, including the Chardon Maple Festival and Geauga County Fair. Our tornado potatoes became a festival favorite.

history.title: Menu Innovation
history.description: Introduced our signature Half and Half potato and Chips + Dip variations. We also started serving Nathan's all-beef hot dogs to complement our potato offerings.

history.title: Expanding Reach
history.description: Started attending events beyond Chardon, including Mentor Rocks and other northeast Ohio festivals. Our social media following grew as more people discovered our unique food truck.

history.title: Looking Forward
history.description: Continuing to serve the best tornado potatoes in Ohio while exploring new flavors and locations. Always committed to quality ingredients and friendly service for our growing family of customers.
